name: clinker production | clinker | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27782/documentation

The dataset describes the production of Portland cement clinker in Tunisia. ;Clinker is the main constituent of Portland cement and also the main responsible for its environmental impacts. Clinker is made by sintering a mixture composed mainly of limestone and clay (called “raw meal”) at temperatures up to 1450 °C. Both primary and secondary fuels are used to this end. After sintering, clinker nodules have a diameter between 5 mm and 25 mm.;;Clinker consists of various calcium silicates including alite (3CaO.SiO2 or “C3S”) and belite (2CaO.SiO2 or “C2S”). Tricalcium aluminate (3CaO.Al2O3 or “C3A”) and calcium aluminoferrite (4CaO.Al2O3.Fe2O3 or “C4AF”) are other common components, added to reduce the sintering temperature of the calcium silicates. For special cement types, such as low heat and sulfate resistant, it is necessary to limit the amount of tricalcium aluminate formed.;Pyroprocessing, and cement preparation: - Raw material extraction - Crushing of raw material - Pre-homogenization and raw meal grinding; - Pre-calcining - Production of clinker - Cooling and storage - Clinker grinding and the cement manufacturing process - Milling of cement;;After the kiln, clinker is cooled and stored in silos. Clinker production plants are usually integrated with cement plants.;Primary data were gathered from one cement manufacturer in Tunisia who informed the total values of inputs and outputs related to clinker production in 2019 considering all their clinker production sites. All types of flows were reported, namely: primary and secondary raw materials and fuels, auxiliary materials, electricity consumption, water consumption and air emissions (from emissions monitoring reports). It corresponds to 15% of the market share, considered a good representativeness level.;SOURCES:; Schorcht, F., Kourti, I., Scalet, B.M., Roudier, S., Sancho, L.D., 2013. Best available techniques (BAT) reference document for the production of cement, lime and magnesium oxide. Eur. Comm. Jt. Res. Cent. Inst. Prospect. Technol. Stud. Rep. EUR 26129 EN Luxemb. Publ. Off. Eur. Union;Boesch, M.E., Koehler, A., Hellweg, S., 2009. Model for Cradle-to-Gate Life Cycle Assessment of Clinker Production. Environ. Sci. Technol. 43, 7578–7583. https://doi.org/10.1021/es900036e

The dataset includes the preparation of raw materials (drying, grinding and homogeneization) and fuels (drying-grinding), preheating and precalcining steps, clinker production in the rotary kiln, cooling and storage in silos. Water is used mainly for dust control. Auxiliary materials for factory maintenance are considered. Air emissions stem mainly from the rotary kiln exhaust.

This activity ends with the storage after cooling of the produced clinker. It includes the whole manufacturing processes to produce clinker (raw material provision, grinding and mixing; rotary kiln process. No administration is included.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The dataset represents a cement plant in Tunisia. The time period is set according to the historical data (2019) collected from the industry.;Data correspond to 2019.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents production of clinker for Tunisia. Data come from one cement manufacturer in Tunisia.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology for clinker production in Tunisian dry kilns, considering various fuel types.;In Tunisia, cement plants use dry kilns with preheater and precalciner, being a total of nine cement plants (eight gray clinker and one white clinker) (dry). This dataset represents data for gray clinker from one cement manufacturer. Regarding fuel types, 88,1% are fossil fuels (petroleum coke), 11% biomass (olive poumace) and 0,9% natural gas (data from 2019).;Sources: ;;Single Market Profile: TUNISIA 2022. ;Institut National de la Statistique. Statistiques Tunisie. BULLETIN MENSUEL DES STATISTIQUES. Janvier 2020
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Primary data corresponding to 15% of the Tunisian cement production were used to represent clinker production on a national scale. Some flows were extrapolated from the clinker production/BR dataset (accessed 30.07.2022).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Primary data were gathered from one cement manufacturer in Tunisia, who informed the total values of inputs and outputs related to clinker production in 2019, considering all their clinker production sites. All types of flows were reported, namely: primary and secondary raw materials and fuels, auxiliary materials, electricity consumption, water consumption and air emissions (from emissions monitoring reports). It corresponds to 15% market share, considered a good representativeness level.
The manufacturer unit flows were calculated, considering its clinker production volume as the weighing factor. This dataset represents the average clinker production for Tunisia. Basic uncertainty was calculated based on the sample's weighted standard deviation.
Water consumption was usually reported for the whole integrated cement plants (clinker + cement production operations). Based on literature and expert opinion, the total water volume was divided equally between the clinker and the cement production processes. Raw materials and fuel inputs were considered to be dry. As water is mainly used for cooling, it was considered that all water evaporates, except for the water input, which was considered to be used as drinking water and whose output is modelled as an effluent.
Fuel consumption was informed by manufacturer in terms of volume or mass. CO2 emissions (both fossil and biogenic) were calculated from fuel inputs. As CO2 emission factors are expressed in terms of energy (kg/GJ), fuel consumption was converted into energy by multiplying them to the corresponding lower heating values. Both the CO2 emission factors and heating values are informed in the "exchange properties" field. 
The manufacturer reported the air emissions. Emission are approximated from other ecoinvent regional datasets: proportion between refractory types; proportion between particulate size classes and the infrastructure flow "industrial machine, heavy, unspecified".
The amounts of the exchanges were calculated considering the weighted average of the sample. No conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was done, for consistency reasons with other ecoinvent datasets.

exchanges.description: Gray clinker for use in cement.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Consumption of fossil fuels x lower heating value x CO2 emission factor (in terms of energy), based on information delivered by the manufacturer. (CO2 emission factors from fossil fuel based on laboratory analysis). CO2 from process based on XRF analysis of clinker. Weighted average of individual values. CO2 of calcination = 0.531 kg/kg clinker. CO2 of fossil combustion (petroluem coke+natural gas) = 0.287 kg/kg clinker.
